entry.title: Incipient p-wave Superconductivity in a Si-MOSFET
entry.summary: We suggest here that the recently-reported ``insulator-metal transition'' in Si MOSFET's is consistent instead with a transition from an insulator to a T=0 p-wave superconducting state.

entry.title: Renormalization group for the XYZ model
entry.summary: We study in a rigorous way the XYZ spin model by Renormalization Group methods.

entry.title: Spin-Charge Separation is the Key to the High T_c Cuprates
entry.summary: We argue that spin charge separation holds the key to the understanding of high temperature superconductivity.

entry.title: Spectroscopic evidence for unconventional superconductivity in UBe$_{13}$
entry.summary: Reply to cond-mat/0007006 by Gloos

entry.title: Does the 2D Hubbard Model Really Show d-Wave Superconductivity?
entry.summary: Some issues concerning the question if the two-dimensional Hubbard model really show d-wave superconductivity are briefly discussed.

entry.summary: Comment on paper by A. Zvyagin, Phys. Rev. B 64, R060405 (2001).

entry.title: Comment on cond-mat/0007299 by Schofield and Sandeman : inconsistency with experiments
entry.summary: The inconsistency of cond-mat/0007299 and Phys. Rev. B 63 094510 (2001) with ARPES and resistivity data is pointed-out.

entry.title: Comment on "Exact Spectral Functions of a Non Fermi Liquid in 1 Dimension"
entry.summary: I point out the incorrect statement of the recent manuscript by K.Penc and B.S.Shastry.

entry.title: On the theory of magnetic impurities in integrable correlated electron chains
entry.summary: Here we clarify few important issues raised in the recent cond-mat/0204241.

entry.title: Hamiltonian Renormalization Groups
entry.summary: A Hamiltonian renormalization group is presented. Such a formulation is relevant for chiralic systems and more appropriate than the Lagrangian formalism. An application to 1D system is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, submitted to the Encyclopedia of Nonlinear Sciences

entry.title: Photocarrier Injection to Transition Metal Oxides
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author(s), due a crucial error in the data.

entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors.

entry.title: Josephson current through a nanoscale quantum dot
entry.summary: Reply to the comment by Choi et al. cond-mat/0410415

entry.title: Reply to Bernevig, Giuliano, and Laughlin
entry.summary: Reply to Bernevig, Giuliano, and Laughlin: cond-mat/0410147

entry.title: Striped Phase of Hubbard Charge Density Waves on Gallium Surface
entry.summary: This paper has been temprally withdrawn by the author

entry.title: Reply to the comment to Phy. Rev. Lett. 86, 3392 (2001) (cond-mat/0511607)
entry.summary: We provide our reply to the comment by Greiter and Schuricht (cond-mat/0511607).

entry.title: Note on the exponent puzzle of the Anderson-Mott transition
entry.summary: The exponent puzzle of the Anderson-Mott transition is discussed on the basis of a duality model for strongly correlated electrons.

entry.title: Pair Formation in a t-J Model
entry.summary: We have investigated the formation of bound state of two electrons in different kind of lattices using a t-J-U model.
entry.arxiv:comment: M.Sc. Thesis. Supervised by Dr. Saurabh Basu, IIT Guwahati, India

entry.title: Agterberg, Zheng, and Mukherjee Reply
entry.summary: Reply to Ikeda (arXiv:0712.3341).
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Phys. Rev. Lett

entry.title: On the existence of Cooper pairs in the Hubbard Model
entry.summary: By means of a new canonical transformation for the one-band Hubbard model at half filling we show the existence of Cooper pairs formed by strongly interacting quasiparticles.

entry.title: Reply to the Comment by S.E. Sebastian and N. Harrison
entry.summary: no abstract for comments

entry.title: Comment on "Multiple Quantum Oscillations in the de Haas-van Alphen Spectra of the Underdoped High-Temperature Superconductor YBa2Cu3O6.5"
entry.summary: Comment withdrawn.

entry.title: On the metallic state in cuprates
entry.summary: We calculate Raman response functions on the Fermi surface in metallic cuprates.

entry.title: Sine-Gordon Equation and Quantum spin transport in one-dimension
entry.summary: We studied the spin transport mechanism in a S=1/2 antiferromagnetic chain.

entry.title: Advanced quantum methods for the largest magnetic molecules
entry.summary: We discuss modern numerical methods for quantum spin systems and their application to magnetic molecules.

entry.title: Permutation Group Symmetry and Correlations
entry.summary: Correlation factors are constructed that are consistent with the permutation symmetry group of N Fermions at given value of the filling factor.

entry.title: Emergent Fractional Charge and Multiple Majoranas
entry.summary: To mark the 111th birthday of Eugene Wigner, we review topological excitations in diverse dimensions.

entry.title: Effective spin-fermion model for strongly correlated electrons
entry.summary: A modified spin-fermion model is proposed to describe the physics of the underdoped phase of the t-J model of strongly correlated electrons

entry.title: Comment on "Selective Interface Control of Order Parameters in Complex Oxides" (arXiv:1505.07451)
entry.summary: We show that the experimental evidence presented in this paper is insufficient to support its conclusions.

entry.title: It has been a Weyl coming
entry.summary: Condensed-matter physics brings us quasiparticles that behave like massless fermions.

entry.title: Normal Helium 3: a Mott-Stoner liquid
entry.summary: A physical picture of normal liquid $^3$He, which accounts for both ``almost localized'' and ``almost ferromagnetic'' aspects, is proposed and confronted to experiments.

entry.title: DMRG study of ferromagnetism in a one-dimensional Hubbard model
entry.summary: The one dimensional Hubbard model with nearest and (negative) next-nearest neighbour hopping has been studied with the density-matrix renormalization group (DMRG) method. A large region of ferromagnetism has been found for finite density and finite on-site interaction.

entry.title: On an SO(5) unification attempt for the cuprates
entry.summary: In this note we bring out several problems with the SO(5) unification attempt of Zhang [cond-mat/9610140].

entry.title: Bethe ansatz equations for Bariev's correlated electron chain with boundaries
entry.summary: The Bethe ansatz equations are presented for Bariev's correlated electron chain with boundaries. This is achieved by using the coordinate space Bethe ansatz method.

entry.title: Properties of Magnetic Impurity in a Metal
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Renormalized vs unrenormalized perturbation-theoretical approaches to the Mott transition
entry.summary: I employ an exactly soluble toy model to investigate why unrenormalized perturbation theory works better than fully self-consistent approaches in describing the correlation-driven metal-insulator transition.

entry.title: Negative Josephson coupling in the Kondo strong coupling limit
entry.summary: We Show that pair hopping through a Kondo singlet give rise to a negative Josephson coupling. Thus, our calculation supports the existance of staggered pair correlations in the strong coupling limit of a one dimensional Kondo lattice.

entry.title: Reply to the Comment on ``Charged impurity scattering limited low temperature resistivity of low density silicon inversion layers''
entry.summary: This is a Reply to the Comment (cond-mat/9812331) by Kravchenko et al. on our earlier work (cond-mat/9812216).

entry.title: Resistive Anomalies at Ferromagnetic Transitions Revisited: the case of SrRuO_3
entry.summary: We show that recent resistivity data on SrRuO_3 for T->T_c are consistent with conventional theory when corrections to scaling are included and a small shift in T_c is allowed.

entry.title: Temperature-dependent logarithmic corrections in the spin-1/2 Heisenberg chain
entry.summary: We obtain the logarithmic corrections to the dynamic response function and NMR T_1 and T_{2G} rates in the spin-1/2 antiferromagnetic Heisenberg chain using perturbative renormalization group in the leading irrelevant operator. The result is compared with NMR experiments in Sr_2CuO_3.

entry.title: Comment on ``Stripes and the t-J Model''
entry.summary: This is a comment being submitted to Physical Review Letters on a recent letter by Hellberg and Manousakis on stripes in the t-J model.

entry.title: Integrable one-dimensional supersymmetric q-deformed extended Hubbard model with boundary Kondo impurity
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author, due to an error in relation (11).

entry.title: Reply to Comment on "Stripes and the t-J Model"
entry.summary: This is a Reply to the Comment of S.R. White and D.J. Scalapino [cond-mat/9907243] on our recent paper ``Stripes and the t-J Model'' [Physical Review Letters 83, 132 (1999) and cond-mat/9812022].

entry.title: On some upper bounds for spin velocity and instability of gapless state of 1-d Heisenberg chains
entry.summary: We derive upper bounds for spin velocity in half-integer-spin Heisenberg antiferromagnetic chains. We relate these upper bounds to the instability of the gapless state, which is observed in frustrated systems.

entry.title: Thermoelectric Response Near the Density Driven Mott Transition
entry.summary: We investigate the thermoelectric response of correlated electron systems near the density driven Mott transition using the dynamical mean field theory.

entry.title: Metallic Spin Glass in Infinite Dimensions
entry.summary: We have combined the dynamical mean field theories of the Mott transition and the spin glass in infinite dimensions and derived a metallic spin-glass state from a random spin-fermion model.

entry.title: Comment on "Two Dimensional Ordering and Fluctuations in alpha'-NaV2O5"
entry.summary: We claim that the analysis presented by Gaulin et al. (Phys. Rev. Lett. 84, 3446 (2000)) does not prove the two-dimensional character of the transition in NaV2O5 nor the charge ordering mechanism of the transition.

entry.title: Note on the magnetotransport in the normal state of high-Tc cuprates
entry.summary: Theories of the magnetotransport, based on the quasipartricle of the Fermi-liquid, in the normal state of high-Tc cuprate superconductors, are critically examined and the necessity of the collective transport theory beyond the quasiparticle is discussed.

entry.title: Level correlations in disordered superconducting grains
entry.summary: I study the quasiparticle level correlations in a grain of a weakly disordered d-wave superconductor, and show that, in a wide intermediate energy range, they are characterized by a novel type of universal behavior.

entry.title: The Jahn-Teller theorem for the 3d magnetic ions
entry.summary: We argue that the Jahn-Teller theorem, if applied to 3d-ion compounds, has to be considered in the orbital+spin space. It is despite of the weakness of the intraatomic spin-orbit coupling.

entry.title: Some Recent Issues in Quantum Magnetism
entry.summary: Summary of Quantum Magnetism Conference, Institute for Theoretical Physics, University of California, Santa Barbara, California, August 16-20, 1999.

entry.title: Comment on "Magnetic Breakdown at High Fields: Semiclassical and Quantum Treatments"
entry.summary: We comment on the study of the spin-damping factor on the de Haas-van Alphen (dHvA) discussed by Han et al. (Phys. Rev. Lett. 85, 1500 (2000)).

entry.title: Ginsburg-Landau Expansion in a non-Fermi Superconductor
entry.summary: We study the Ginsburg-Landau expansion for the non-Fermi model proposed by Anderson. We analyze the deviations of the main properties of a non-Fermi superconductor from the isotropic s-wave bidimensiona superconductor.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, 3 figures, accepted for publication in Physica C

entry.title: Why high Tc is exciting
entry.summary: This piece has been written for local, educational purposes. If you are like me searching for the right words to explain your fascination with high Tc superconductivity to the outside world, you might find something useful in this text.

entry.title: A dynamical mean field theory for the magnetic transition temperature of ferromagnetic semiconductors
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors due to a numerical error. A revised version will be posted shortly.

entry.title: Comment on "Origin of Giant Optical Nonlinearity in Charge-Transfer--Mott Insulators: A New Paradigm for Nonlinear Optics"
entry.summary: Comment on Phys. Rev. Lett. 86, 2086 (2001)

entry.title: Interacting quantum spin chains. [Invited paper for the International Conference on Neutron Scattering ICNS-2001.]
entry.summary: A brief review of recent advances in neutron scattering studies of low-dimensional quantum magnets is followed by a particular example. The separation of single-particle and continuum states in the weakly-coupled $S=1/2$ chains system BaCu2Si2O7 is described in some detail.

entry.title: Luttinger liquid with asymmetric dispersion
entry.summary: Paper withdrawn by authors. See new version in this same listing.

entry.title: The Net Spin Model
entry.summary: We study a set of exactly soluble spin models in one and two dimensions for any spin $S$. Its ground state, the excitation spectrum, quantum phase transition points, as well as dimensional crossover are determined.

entry.title: Whither Correlated Electron Theory?
entry.summary: This is the text of the 'Theory' opening talk at the 2001 Strongly Correlated Electron Systems conference. It contains opinions about some of the outstanding scientific challenges facing the theory side of the correlated electrons field.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages. No figures. To appear in Physica B

entry.title: Charged fixed point in the 2+1 dimensional compact U(1) abelian Higgs model
entry.summary: Paper withdrawn; see comments
entry.arxiv:comment: Paper withdrawn; for a much more complete treatment, see cond-mat/0207501

entry.title: Superstring representation of Hubbard model
entry.summary: The new method of investigation of strongly correlated electronic system is presented. Using this method we have derived thee superstring from 2D Hubbard model. The novel expression for generalized supercoherent state has been calculated.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proc.XI Int. Conf. "Problems of Quantum Field Theory", Dubna, 1999,p.311-315

entry.title: Comment on "Detecting the Kondo Screening Cloud Around a Quantum Dot"
entry.summary: We point out several mistakes in the recent works of I.Affleck and P.Simon (cond-mat/0012002).
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 2 figures, RevTeX4, some corrections introduced

entry.title: Comment:on possible time reversal symmetry breaking in normal state of ruthenate
entry.summary: A spiral spin structure with a nesting vector is expected to be the ground normal state of $Sr_2RuO_4$. It might be observable with use of the ARPES method with circularly polarised photons desighned by A.Kaminsky et al. (cond-mat/0203133).

entry.title: Reply to Schlottmann and Zvyagin
entry.summary: This is a reply to a comment by P. Schlottmann and A.A. Zvyagin.

entry.title: From the double-exchange Hamiltonian to the $t-J$ model: Classical spins
entry.summary: From the double-exchange Hamiltonian with classical localized spins in the limit of large but finit Hund exchange coupling we obtain the $t-J$ model (with classical localized spins).

entry.title: Reply to Comment on "Weak anisotropy and disorder dependence of the in-plane magnetoresistance in high mobility (100) Si-inversion layers"
entry.summary: Reply to the Comment by V.T. Dolgopolov and A.V. Gold [cond-mat/0203276].

entry.title: Spin-Particle Connections
entry.summary: This is a topical review on the generalization of the Jordan-Wigner transformations to any spin and spatial dimensions.

entry.title: Magnetic Transition in the Kondo Lattice System CeRhSn2
entry.summary: Our resistivity, magnetoresistance, magnetization and specific heat data provide unambiguous evidence that CeRhSn2 is a Kondo lattice system which undergoes magnetic transition below 4 K.

entry.title: Spin-charge separation and recombination in quantum disordered d-wave superconductors
entry.summary: Some of the results of this paper have been superseded in the meantime. See, cond-mat/0410557.

entry.title: Spin-Wave Theory for s=1 Antiferromagnetic Isotropic Chain
entry.summary: In the paper we describe the modification of spin-wave theory for one-dimensional isotropic antiferromagnet. This theory enables to obtain the energy of magnetic excitations of short wave length and correlation function in agreement with numerical studies.

entry.title: Comment on "Algebraic Fermi liquid from phase fluctuations: topological fermions, vortex Berryons, and QED theory of cuprate superconductors"
entry.summary: Comment on the Letter by M. Franz and Z. Tesanovic, Phys. Rev. Lett. v.87, p.257003 (2001).

entry.title: Reply to `Comment on "Gapless Spin-1 Neutral Collective Mode Branch for Graphite"' by Peres et al
entry.summary: Reply to `Comment on "Gapless Spin-1 Neutral Collective Mode Branch for Graphite"' by Peres et al [cond-mat/0312263].

entry.title: Possible fractal structure of exact universal exchange-correlation potential
entry.summary: Heuristic arguments are presented to show that the basic quantity of density functional theory - exact universal exchange-correlation potential should have fractal structure.

entry.title: Heisenberg Spins on a Circular Conical Surface
entry.summary: We investigate classical Heisenberg spins on a conical surface. The energy and configuration of non-trivial spin distributions are obtained using a non-conventional method based on Einstein theory of gravity in lower dimensions.

entry.title: Low temperature charge ordering versus grain boundary effects in polycrystalline La1-xCaxMnO3 manganites
entry.summary: In this communication the enhancement of low temperature magnetoresistance in polycrystalline La1-xCaxMnO3 manganites is discussed. It is shown that so-called grain boundary effects seem to be the simplest and natural explanation of this phenomenon.

entry.title: T^{2/3} resistivity and the field-tuned quantum critical point in CeCoIn5
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn. Please see cond-mat/0605124 for new and updated data and conclusions pertaining to this study.

entry.title: Comment on "Relevance of Cooperative Lattice Effects and Stress Fields in Phase-Separation Theories for CMR Manganites"
entry.summary: We comment on a recent work by Burgy, Moreo, and Dagotto, Phys. Rev. Lett. V.92, 097202 (2004) (cond-mat/0308456).

entry.title: Magnetism in Carbon Structures
entry.summary: We discuss different magnetic phenomena observed in carbon-based structures, in particular the diamagnetism, paramagnetism and ferromagnetism observed in graphite, disordered carbon, fullerenes and irradiated carbon structures.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 3 figures, to be published in the proceedings of JEMS04, JMMM

entry.title: Shashkin et al. reply to cond-mat/0410409
entry.summary: We show that the Comment by Reznikov and Sivan (cond-mat/0410409) is erroneous because the authors do not distinguish between Pauli and Curie spin susceptibility.

entry.title: One-Dimensional Magnetism
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Comment on "Effects of Thickness on the Spin Susceptibility of the Two Dimensional Electron Gas"
entry.summary: A comment on a recent paper (PRL {\bf 94}, 226405 (2005)) by S. De Palo, M. Botti, S. Moroni, and Gaetano Senatore.

entry.title: Magnetic Phases of Rare Earth Hexagonal Manganites
entry.summary: We describe the magnetic phases of hexagonal rare earth manganites RMnO3 using Landau theory. A minimal model based on four one-dimensional magnetic order parameters is developed.

entry.title: Equilibration of Two-dimensional Excitons in an In-Plane Harmonic Potential
entry.summary: This paper is currently withdrawn and is being revised by the authors.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper is presently being revised by the authors

entry.title: Comment on "Projective Quantum Monte Carlo Method for the Anderson Impurity Model and its Application to Dynamical Mean Field Theory"
entry.summary: A comment about importance of Anderson's orthogonality catastrophe for projective Quantum Monte Carlo methods.

entry.title: Disordered phase of a two-dimensional Heisenberg Model with S=1
entry.summary: We study an anisotropic version of the $J_1-J_2$ model with S=1. We find a second order transition from a N\'eel $Q=(\pi,\pi)$ phase to a disordered phase with a spin gap.

entry.title: High-Field Low-Frequency Spin Dynamics
entry.summary: The theory of exchange symmetry of spin ordered states is extended to the case of high magnetic field. Low frequency spin dynamics equation for quasi-goldstone mode is derived for two cases of collinear and noncollinear antiferromagnets.

entry.title: Inter-Spin State Transition associated with magnetization jump in Y0.33Sr0.67CoO3
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors due to lack of significant consideration.

entry.summary: Comment on B.A. Bernevig, D. Giuliano, and R.B. Laughlin, Phys. Rev. Lett. 86, 3392 (2001).

entry.title: Density wave states in superfluid
entry.summary: The paper is temporarily withheld

entry.title: Anisotropic Correlations in Epitaxial Iron Silicide: Contribution of Surface and Bulk States
entry.summary: Scanning tunneling microscopy

entry.title: Reply to the comment by Ying Zhang and S. Das Sarma
entry.summary: We reply to the comment by Ying Zhang and S. Das Sarma on our PRL 94, 226405 (2005).

entry.title: Anisotropic Spin Couplings and the Inelastic Neutron Cross Section of NaNiO_2
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn due to an error. We plan to replace it with a corrected version.

entry.title: Spin Freezing and Melting in Na$_{0.5}$CoO$_{2}$
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn. The sample was a mixed phase.

entry.title: Comment on ``Orbital-selective Mott transitions in two-band Hubbard models''
entry.summary: A recent paper by Bluemer et al. [cond-mat/0609758] again criticizes earlier QMC/DMFT results by Liebsch [Phys. Rev. B {\bf 70}, 165103 (2004)]. This criticism is shown to be unfounded.

entry.title: Polarons: from single polaron to short scale phase separation
entry.summary: Short review of the phase separation in the system of charged polarons.
entry.arxiv:comment: 18 pages 5 figures, to be published in Polarons in Advanced Materials, Ed. A. S. Alexandrov (Canopus/Springer Publishing, Bristol) (2007)

entry.title: Series expansion for the density of states of the Ising and Potts models
entry.summary: An approximation of the density of states for the Ising and Potts models based on the high- and low-temperature series are developed.

entry.title: Current-Noise Spectroscopy with a Scanning Tunneling Microscope
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn due to fundamental errors.

entry.title: Frontier at your fingertips
entry.summary: Between the nano- and micrometre scales, the collective behaviour of matter can give rise to startling emergent properties that hint at the nexus between biology and physics.
entry.arxiv:comment: Archival copy of Nature Connections Article

entry.title: Anisotropic magnetoresistance involves metal-insulator transition in single crystal La0.77Ca0.23MnO3
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn for some reasons

entry.title: Comment on "Theory of helimagnons in itinerant quantum systems" by D.Belitz, T.K.Kirpatrick and A.Rosch and "Cubic magnets with Dzyaloshinskii-Moriya interaction at low temperatures" by S.V.Maleyev
entry.summary: Comment on "Theory of helimagnons in itinerant quantum systems" by D.Belitz, T.K.Kirpatrick and A.Rosch and "Cubic magnets with Dzyaloshinskii-Moriya interaction at low temperatures" by S.V.Maleyev

entry.title: A Fermi Sea of Heavy Electrons (a Kondo Lattice) is Never a Fermi Liquid
entry.summary: I demonstrate a contradiction which arises if we assume that the Fermi surface in a heavy electron metal represents a finite jump in occupancy.

entry.title: Quantum Percolation in Disordered Structures
entry.summary: In this lecture note we demonstrated the capability of the local distribution approach to the problem of quantum percolation.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Lecture Notes in Physics 762, Springer-Verlag, Berlin, Heidelberg, New York (2008), pp. 135

entry.title: Low-energy Mott-Hubbard excitations in LaMnO$_3$
entry.summary: More discussion from the theory is suggested

entry.title: Quantum phase transitions in two-dimensional electron systems
entry.summary: This is a chapter for the book "Understanding Quantum Phase Transitions" edited by Lincoln D. Carr (Taylor & Francis, Boca Raton, 2010)

entry.title: How to recognize a nearly-flat-band ferromagnet by means of thermodynamic measurements?
entry.summary: We make an attempt at unveiling the thermodynamic "signature" of a specific class of electronic systems, the so called nearly-flat-band paramagnets and ferromagnets that can theoretically be described by appropriate versions of the Hubbard model.

entry.title: Comment on "Anderson transition in disordered graphene"
entry.summary: We comment on a recent letter by Amini et al. (EPL 87, 37002 (2009)) concerning the existence of a mobility edge in disordered graphene.

entry.title: Tensor networks-a new tool for old problems
entry.summary: A new renormalization group approach that maps lattice problems to tensor networks may hold the key to solving seemingly intractable models of strongly correlated systems in any dimension. A Physics Viewpoint on arXiv:0903.1069

entry.title: New method for the quantum ground states in one dimension
entry.summary: A simple, general and practically exact method is developed to calculate the ground states of 1D macroscopic quantum systems with translational symmetry. Applied to the Hubbard model, a modest calculation reproduces the Bethe Ansatz results.

entry.title: Fractionalize This
entry.summary: Precisely what are the electrons in a high-temperature superconductor doing before they superconduct? Strong electronic correlations may give rise to composite rather than fractionalized excitations, as is typical in other strongly coupled systems such as quark matter.

entry.title: Classical realization of two-site Fermi-Hubbard systems
entry.summary: A classical wave optics realization of the two-site Hubbard model, describing the dynamics of interacting fermions in a double-well potential, is proposed based on light transport in evanescently-coupled optical waveguides.

entry.title: Electrodynamics effects in 3+1 dimensions induced by interactions in Topological Insulators
entry.summary: We investigate the effect of interactions in the Topological Insulator in 3+1 dimensions. We show that for a particular type of interactions, the Electrodynamics response is equivalent to the response of non-interacting Topological Insulator in 4+1 dimensions.

entry.title: The apparent Fermi liquid concept helps to understand thermoelectric materials
entry.summary: Invited expert opinion on the article S. Kremer and R. Fresard, Ann. Phys. (Berlin) 524, 21 (2012).

entry.title: On origin of 1/f noise in manganites: memoryless transport against mysterious slow fluctuators
entry.summary: An alternative explanation of 1/f-noise in manganites is suggested and discussed

entry.title: Stripe Structures in the t-t'-J Model
entry.summary: Here, based upon density matrix renormalization group calculations, we discuss the structure of the stripes found in the doped $t$-$t^\prime$-$J$ model and the physics that underlies their formation.

entry.title: High-frequency longitudinal oscillations of quasi-two-dimensional electron liquid
entry.summary: The specific character of longitudinal collective electromagnetic oscillations in a layered conductor with the quasi-two-dimensional electron energy spectrum has been analyzed.

entry.title: Comment on "Anisotropic Critical Magnetic Fluctuations in the Ferromagnetic Superconductor UCoGe"
entry.summary: We have presented the potential explanation of nonvanishing at q=0 Landau damping measured experimentally in ferromagnetic compounds UGe2 and UCoGe based on possible intersection of the Fermi sheets corresponding different bands.

entry.title: Spin Structures of Spin-Orbit Coupled Square-Lattice Antiferromagnets
entry.summary: We have realized that our results have a strong overlap with those previously published in J Chovan, N Papanicolaou, and S Komineas, Phys.Rev.B65,064433(2002).
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors

entry.title: Metals get an awkward cousin
entry.summary: A newly predicted state of matter is a simple theoretical example of a phase that conducts electricity but is not smoothly connected to our conventional model of metals. A viewpoint on arXiv:1201.5998.

entry.title: The Gutzwiller Density Functional Theory
entry.summary: In this tutorial presentation, we give a comprehensive introduction into the Gutzwiller variational approach and its merger with the density functional theory. The merits of this method are illustrated by a discussion of results for two-band Hubbard models and realistic multi-band Hamiltonians for iron-pnictide systems.

entry.title: Effects of Dzyaloshinskii-Moriya interaction on Spin 1/2 XY Model with Ring Exchange on a Triangular Lattice
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn because it overlaps with arXiv:1203.6583
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn because it overlaps with arXiv:1203.6583

entry.title: Density matrix theory in real space of exchange and correlation energies for organic $Ï$ electronic systems
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to error in equation (46).

entry.title: Numerical Simulations of Laser Induced Magnetic Bloch Oscillations
entry.summary: We propose to use a laser to generate magnetic Bloch oscillations in one dimensional easy-axis ferromagnets at low temperatures. This proposal is investigated numerically in details for material parameters relevant for CoCl2*2H2O.

entry.title: Comment on "Z2-slave-spin theory for strongly correlated fermions" + Reply to the Reply to the "Comment on ?Z2-slave-spin theory for strongly correlated" fermions?
entry.summary: We discusss the results published by Ruegg et al in PRB 81, 155118 (2010).
entry.arxiv:comment: The first Comment was published in PRB 87,037101 (2013)

entry.title: Multi-orbital Cluster Perturbation Theory for transition metal oxides
entry.summary: We present an extension of Cluster Perturbation Theory to include many body correlations associated to local e-e repulsion in real materials. We show that this approach can describe the physics of complex correlated materials where different atomic species and different orbitals coexist. The prototypical case of MnO is considered.

entry.title: Comment on `Non-existence of the Luttinger-Ward functional and misleading convergence of skeleton diagrammatic series for Hubbard-like models'
entry.summary: The known analytical properties of the Green's function and self-energy rule out an ambiguity of the self-energy. The noninteracting Green's functions obtained by Kozik et al. in arXiv:1407.5687 likely have pathological properties.

entry.title: R-matrices for integrable axially symmetric S=1 spin chains
entry.summary: The Reshetikhin condition for the general Hamiltonian density matrix of the $S=1$ axially symmetric spin chain is completely solved. 16 new integrable models and corresponding $R$-matrices are presented.

entry.title: Comment on "Low-Temperature Magnetic Properties of the Kondo Lattice Model in One Dimension"
entry.summary: This is a comment for a paper entitled "Low-Temperature Magnetic Properties of the Kondo Lattice Model in One Dimension" [S.Minami and H.Kawamura, JPSJ84,044702(2015)].

entry.title: Viewpoint: duality for fermionic vortices
entry.summary: This is a version (less professional editing, more details and jokes) of an APS Physics Viewpoint about three recent papers extending charge-vortex duality to fermionic vortices.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, 1 figure. Fancier version at http://physics.aps.org/articles/v9/72

entry.title: Bringing order to the expanding fermion zoo
entry.summary: Crystallography provides an inventory of the electron-like particles that emerge in a lattice world. Perspective for Science on arXiv:1603.03093
entry.arxiv:comment: pre-copy-editing, author-produced version of the published paper: 4 pages, 1 figure

entry.title: Treatment of the singularities of the Stermheimer function for a layered electron gas
entry.summary: Isolating the singularity in the Green's function solution of the inhomogeneous, differential equation for the Stermheimer function of a layered electron gas, permits the construction of an approximate solution of the Stermheimer function which includes the exact contributions from its singularities.

entry.title: Electronic Properties Of Buckminsterfullerenes: Degeneracies and Surprises
entry.summary: Buckminsterfullerene compounds exibit remarkable physics at low temperatures, e.g. high temperature superconductivity in alkali-fullerenes, and ferromagnetism in TDAE -C60. Here we review recent theoretical studies of electron correlations in these compounds. In particular, we discuss models of electron-vibron interactions, electron-electron interactions, and intermolecular hopping. We show that the origin of novel electronic phases lies in {\em local} degeneracies of C60; a direct consequence of the high molecular symmetry.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex, to appear in Fullerene Science and Technology

entry.title: Fermi Surface of the 2D Hubbard Model at Weak Coupling
entry.summary: We calculate the interaction-induced deformation of the Fermi surface in the two-dimensional Hubbard model within second order perturbation theory. Close to half-filling, interactions enhance anisotropies of the Fermi surface, but they never modify the topology of the Fermi surface in the weak coupling regime.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, LaTeX2e, 5 embedded EPS figures, accepted to be published in Z. Phys. B

entry.title: Spectral Functions for the Holstein Model
entry.summary: We perform an unitary transformation for the symmetric phonon mode of the Holstein molecular crystal hamiltonian. We show how to compute the electronic spectral functions by exact numerical diagonalisation of an effective hamiltonian fully taking account of the symmetric phonon mode, usually discarded.

entry.title: The Generalized Gutzwiller Method for n=>2 Correlated Orbitals: Itinerant Ferromagnetism in eg-bands
entry.summary: Using the generalized Gutzwiller method we present results on the ferromagnetic behavior of extended Hubbard models with two degenerate eg orbitals. We find significant differences to results obtained from Hartree-Fock theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages in Latex, 3 figures. Accepted for publication in Physica B

entry.title: Integer filling metal insulator transitions in the degenerate Hubbard model
entry.summary: We obtain exact numerical solutions of the degenerate Hubbard model in the limit of large dimensions (or large lattice connectivity). Successive Mott-Hubbard metal insulator transitions at integer fillings occur at intermediate values of the interaction and low enough temperature in the paramagnetic phase. The results are relevant for transition metal oxides with partially filled narrow degenerate bands.

entry.title: Correlations in one-dimensional disordered electronic systems with interaction
entry.summary: We investigate the effects of randomness in a strongly correlated electron model in one-dimension at half-filling. The ground state correlation functions are exactly written by products of 3$\times$3 transfer matrices and are evaluated numerically. The correlation lengths depend on randomness when the interaction is effectively weak. On the contrary, they are completely insensitive to randomness when the interaction is effectively strong.

entry.title: Organic Superconductors: Reduced Dimensionality and Correlation Effects
entry.summary: In this tutorial we will tackle the problem of electronic correlations in quasi-one-dimensional organic superconductors. We will go through different pieces of experimental evidence showing the range of applicability of the Fermi and Luttinger liquid descriptions of the normal phase of the Bechgaard salts series and their sulfur analogs.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 8 eps Figures, ICSM style included Proc. of ICSM'96, to appear in Synthetic Metals

entry.title: Low Energy Properties of the (n,n) Carbon Nanotubes
entry.summary: According to band theory, an ideal undoped (n,n) carbon nanotube is metallic. We show that the electron-electron interaction causes it to become Mott insulating with a spin gap. More interestingly, upon doping it develops superconducting fluctuations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5pages, 2eps figures, one reference added, final version, accepted to PRL

entry.title: The Quantum O(N) Heisenberg Antiferromagnet for N -> infinityy
entry.summary: We study the O(N) quantum Heisenberg antiferromagnet using a parametrisation in terms of real fermions. The N->infinity limit of the model is controlled by a saddle point that is infinitely degenerate in many cases and which represents singlet states on dimers that cover the lattice. Our results are similar to results reported previously on an SU(N) generalisation of the quantum Heisenberg antiferromagnet for N->infinity.

entry.title: Luttinger Theorem in One Dimensional Metals
entry.summary: One dimensional metals are described by Luttinger liquid theory. Recent experiments have addressed the relation between this non-Fermi liquid behavior and the existence of a Fermi surface. We show that Luttinger's theorem, with few modifications, holds for the one-dimensional Tomonaga-Luttinger model. The implications for the high temperature superconductors are discussed.

entry.title: Antiferromagnetic systems with spin gap: exact results
entry.summary: We describe some antiferromagnetic systems which exhibit spin gaps. We also discuss the effect of doping one such system, namely, the spin-ladders, with holes. Some model antiferromagnetic systems with spin gap are reviewed for which exact results are available. Exact results for a doped spin-ladder model are also mentioned.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages, LaTeX, 2 postscript figures, To be published in Proceedings of Conference on 70 Years of Quantum Mechanics and Recent Trends in Theoretical Physics, ed. by P. Bandyopadhyay, ISI, Calcutta, (1997)

entry.title: Kondo Effect in a Metal with Correlated Conduction Electrons
entry.summary: The large-degeneracy expansion for dilute magnetic alloys is extended to account for conduction electrons interactions. Particular attention is paid to the renormalization of the hybridization vertex which affects the low-energy excitations. As a first example, we calculate the enhanced characteristic energy $k_BT_0$ in the limit of weakly correlated conduction electrons. The metallic regime with strongly correlated electrons is discussed.

entry.title: Fluctuation effects of gauge fields in the slave-boson t-J model
entry.summary: We present a quantitative study of the charge-spin separation(CSS) phenomenon in a U(1) gauge theory of the t-J model of high-Tc superconductures. We calculate the critical temperature of confinement-deconfinement phase transition below which the CSS takes place.

entry.title: Green Function of the Sutherland Model with SU(2) internal symmetry
entry.summary: We obtain the hole propagator of the Sutherland model with SU(2) internal symmetry for coupling parameter $\beta=1$, which is the simplest nontrivial case. One created hole with spin down breaks into two quasiholes with spin down and one quasihole with spin up. While these elementary excitations are energetically free, the form factor reflects their anyonic character. The expression for arbitrary integer $\beta$ is conjectured.

entry.title: One-dimensional Kondo lattice at partial band filling
entry.summary: An effective Hamiltonian for the localized spins in the one-dimensional Kondo lattice model is derived via a unitary transformation involving a bosonization of delocalized conduction electrons. The effective Hamiltonian is shown to reproduce all the features of the model as identified in various numerical simulations, and provides much new information on the ferro- to paramagnetic phase transition and the paramagnetic phase.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages Revtex, 1 Postscript figure. To appear in Phys. Rev. Lett

entry.title: Spin-Charge Separation in Angle-Resolved Photoemission Spectra
entry.summary: The implications of the angle-resolved photoemission spectroscopy (ARPES) on the issue of spin-charge separation are discussed from the viewpoint of slave-particle RVB theories. It is pointed out that the non-local phase string is essential to reproduce the two-peak structure experimentally observed in SrCuO_2. The comparison between 1D and 2D cases is also made.

entry.title: Mixed Heisenberg Chains. I. The Ground State Problem
entry.summary: We consider a mechanism for competing interactions in alternating Heisenberg spin chains due to the formation of local spin-singlet pairs. The competition of spin-1 and spin-0 states reveals hidden Ising symmetry of such alternating chains.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, RevTeX, 4 embedded eps figures, final version
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: J. Phys.: Condens. Matter 9 No 42, p. 9031-9042 (1997)

entry.title: Determination of Exchange Parameters from Magnetic Susceptibility
entry.summary: We report a novel practical method to determine exchange parameters by using experimental susceptibility data in a relatively narrow temperature region and a low order high-temperature-expansion equation. This method is applied to a square lattice and a CaV_4O_9-type lattice, and its accuracy is discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5pages, LaTeX, a figure available on request from takano@toyota-ti.ac.jp, to be published in J. Phys. Soc. Jpn. Vol. 66

entry.title: Quasi-Langevin method for shot noise calculation in single-electron tunneling
entry.summary: It is shown that quasi-Langevin method can be used for the calculation of the shot noise in correlated single-electron tunneling. We generalize the existing Fokker-Plank-type approach and show its equivalence to quasi-Langevin approach. The advantage of the quasi-Langevin method is a natural possibility to describe simultaneously the high (``quantum'') frequency range.

entry.title: A Kondo impurity in one dimensional correlated conduction electrons
entry.summary: A spin-1/2 magnetic impurity coupled to a one-dimensional correlated electron system have been studied by applying the density renormalization group method. The Kondo temperature is substantially enhanced by strong repulsive interactions in the chain, but changes non-monotonically in the case of electron attraction. The magnetization of the impurity at zero- temperature shows local Fermi liquid behavior.

author.name: Xiaoqun Wang
author.arxiv:affiliation: Max-Planck-Institut fÃ¼r Physik komplexer Systeme, Dresden Germany

entry.title: Comment on "Single Hole Dynamics in the CuO$_2$ Plane at Half Filling"
entry.summary: In a recent letter, Pothuizen et al. reported angle-resolved photoemission data on the single-layer insulating cuprate Sr_2CuO_2Cl_2. This comment addresses the issue whether it is possible to deduce an accurate value for the O 2p hopping integral $t_{pp}$ from these experiments, and also cautions against drawing conclusions concerning scattering mechanisms in the CuO_2 plane from a line-width analysis.

entry.title: Adiabatic connection between the RVB State and the ground state of the half filled periodic Anderson model
entry.summary: A one-parameter family of models that interpolates between the periodic Anderson model with infinite repulsion at half-filling and a model whose ground state is exactly the Resonating-Valence-Bond state is studied. It is shown numerically that the excitation gap does not collapse. Therefore the ground states of the two models are adiabatically connected.

entry.title: An Extended Anderson Model that shows Decreasing Resistivity with Decreasing Temperature
entry.summary: The resistivity for an extended two channel Anderson model is calculated. When the temperature decreases, it decreases logarithmically, and has T^1/2 anomaly at very low temperatures, as seen in some dilute U alloys. The single-particle and the spin excitation spectra are also calculated.

entry.title: Block-Spin Approach to Electron Correlations
entry.summary: We consider an expansion of the ground state wavefunction of quantum lattice many-body systems in a basis whose states are tensor products of block-spin wavefunctions. We demonstrate by applying the method to the antiferromagnetic spin-1/2 chain that by selecting the most important many-body states the technique affords a severe truncation of the Hilbert space while maintaining high accuracy.

entry.title: Hund's-Rule Coupling Effect in Itinerant Ferromagnetism
entry.summary: We present a general model which includes the ferromagnetic Kondo lattice and the Hubbard model as special cases. The stability of the ferromagnetic state is investigated variationally. We discuss the mechanism of ferromagnetism in metallic nickel, emphasizing the importance of orbital degeneracy and the effect of the Hund's-rule coupling.
entry.arxiv:comment: 19 pages, 10 figures, to appear in Prog.Theor.Phys

entry.title: Reply to the Comment on "Electric Field Scaling at a B=0 Metal-Insulator Transition in Two Dimensions"
entry.summary: We note that data on Si/SiGe heterostructures, reported in the Comment of Ismail et al. (cond-mat/9707061) on our recent Letter (cond-mat/9608101), are insufficient to establish the claim for a transition to a metallic phase.

author.name: S. V. Kravchenko
author.arxiv:affiliation: City College of the City University of New York

author.name: D. Simonian
author.arxiv:affiliation: City College of the City University of New York

author.name: M. P. Sarachik
author.arxiv:affiliation: City College of the City University of New York

entry.title: Q1D organic metals:the electronic contribution to the equation of state
entry.summary: Starting from the recently derived expression for the chemical potential of the electron gas on a 1D lattice,and a well known thermodynamical relation,we have derived the equation of state and the specific heat of the electron gas on a 1D lattice.
entry.arxiv:comment: plain LaTeX file,no figures.The expression for the specific heat has been added,and the numbering of equations corrected

entry.title: Exact realization of SO(5) symmetry in extended Hubbard models
entry.summary: Zhang recently conjectured an approximate SO(5) symmetry relating antiferromagnetic and superconducting states in high-T_c cuprates. Here, an exact SO(5) symmetry is implemented in a generalized Hubbard model (with long-range interactions) on a lattice. The possible relation to a more realistic extended Hubbard Hamiltonian is discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, LaTeX; no figures; submitted, Phys. Rev. Lett

entry.title: Valley Phase Transition in Si MOSFETs
entry.summary: We draw attention to the past literature on valley phase transition in Si(100) MOSFETs. The recent experiments performed by Kravchenko and co-workers indicating metal-insulator transition in Si MOSFETs are also in accord with the valley phase transition mechanism.

author.name: C. Bulutay
author.arxiv:affiliation: Middle East Technical University, Ankara, Turkey

author.name: M. Tomak
author.arxiv:affiliation: Middle East Technical University, Ankara, Turkey

entry.title: Magnetic susceptibility and low-temperature specific-heat of integrable 1-D Hubbard model under open-boundary conditions
entry.summary: The magnetic susceptibility and the low-temperature specific heat of the 1-dimensional Hubbard model under the integrable open-boundary conditions are discussed through the Bethe ansatz with the string hypothesis. The contributions of the boundary fields to both the susceptibility and the specific heat are obtained, and their exact expressions are analytically derived.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, Latex, No figures, to appear in J. Phys. A: Gen. & Math

entry.title: Hall Effect in a Quasi-One-Dimensional System
entry.summary: We consider the Hall effect in a system of weakly coupled one-dimensional chains with Luttinger interaction within each chain. We construct a perturbation theory in the inter-chain hopping term and find that there is a power law dependence of the Hall conductivity on the magnetic field with an exponent depending on the interaction constant. We show that this perturbation theory becomes valid if the magnetic field is sufficiently large.

entry.title: Current ideas on the origin of stripes
entry.summary: It will be attempted to present a coherent view on the current ideas regarding the origin of the stripe instability. Special emphasis will be put on the problem of how to combine the microscopic pictures, leaning on spin-charge topological aspects, with the notion of frustrated phase separation.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages Revtex, 2 figures, proc. of the SNS '97 conference (submitted to J. Phys. Chem. Sol.)

entry.title: An Order Parameter for the Mott-Hubbard Transition in One Dimension
entry.summary: We propose an order parameter for the one dimensional Mott-Hubbard transition and provide numerical evidence and general theoretical arguments for the correctness of our proposal. In addition, we discuss some of the implications of this picture of the one dimensional Mott-Hubbard transition and speculate about possible higher dimensional analogs.

entry.title: Spin and energy correlations in the one dimensional spin 1/2 Heisenberg model
entry.summary: In this paper, we study the spin and energy dynamic correlations of the one dimensional spin 1/2 Heisenberg model, using mostly exact diagonalization numerical techniques. In particular, observing that the uniform spin and energy currents decay to finite values at long times, we argue for the absence of spin and energy diffusion in the easy plane anisotropic Heisenberg model.

entry.title: Bose-Hubbard Hamiltonian from generalized commutation rules
entry.summary: In a first order approximation, the Bose-Hubbard Hamiltonian with on site interaction is obtained from the free Hamiltonian (U=0) and generalized commutation relation for the annihilation-creation operators. Similar generalized commutation relations were used for the first time in high energy physics. The spectrum of the system can be found formally by using the algebraic properties of the generalized operators.

entry.title: Lax pair for SU(n) Hubbard model
entry.summary: For one dimensional SU(n) Hubbard model, a pair of Lax operators are derived, which give a set of fundamental equations for the quantum inverse scattering method under both periodic and open boundary conditions. This provides another proof of the integrability of the model under periodic boundary condition.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex file, 7 pages, little change added

entry.title: Adiabatic Behaviour of a 2-D Hole Gas near the B=0 Metal-Insulator transition
entry.summary: No abstract available.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn. A similar adiabatic cooling effect has been observed in the low field Shubnikov-de Haas oscillations of a high mobility GaAs/GaAlAs 2-D electron system. The relationship between the two phenomena is being investigated

entry.title: Exact Correlation Amplitude for the S=1/2 Heisenberg Antiferromagnetic Chain
entry.summary: The exact amplitude for the asymptotic correlation function in the S=1/2 Heisenberg antiferromagnetic chain is determined: <S^a_0 S^b_r> goes to (-1)^r delta^{ab}(ln r)^{1/2}/[(2 pi)^{3/2}r]. The behaviour of the correlation functions for small xxz anisotropy and the form of finite-size corrections to the correlation function are also analysed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 3 figures, added reference and discussion

entry.title: Similarities between organic and cuprate superconductors
entry.summary: This ``Perspective'' briefly reviews recent work showing that a class of organic superconductors have important similarities to the cuprate superconductors: (i) There is competition betweeen superconductivity and antiferromagnetism. (ii) Uncoventional metallic behavior is observed near the metal-insulator transition. A more detailed review and discussion of the appropriate strongly correlated electron model can be found in cond-mat/9802198.

author.name: Ross H. McKenzie
author.arxiv:affiliation: University of New South Wales, Sydney, Australia

entry.title: Influence of Beam Divergence and Crystal Mosaic Structure Upon Parametric X-Ray Radiation Characteristics
entry.summary: Based on kinematic model of parametric X-ray Radiation (PXR), an approach for calculation of PXR characteristics (spectrum, intensity, polarization and yield) has been developed. The approach allows to take into account the beam divergence, mosaicity, aperture sizes, influence of $K$-edge, etc. using a uniform technique.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages, LaTeX, 3 Postscript figures, uses epsf.sty

entry.title: Conductivity in Two-Dimensional Disordered Model with Anisotropic Long-Range Hopping
entry.summary: We consider two-dimensional system of particles localized on randomly distributed sites of squared lattice with anisotropic transfer matrix elements between localized sites. By summing of "diffusion ladder" and "cooperon ladder" type vertices we calculated the conductivity for various sites and particles densities.

entry.title: The two-leg t-J ladder: a spin liquid generated by Gutzwiller projection of magnetic bands
entry.summary: The ground state of the two-leg Heisenberg ladder is identified as an RVB type spin liquid, which is generated by Gutzwiller projection of tight-binding bands with flux pi per plaquet. Explicit trial wave functions for the magnon and hole excitations are formulated in terms of spinons and holons.

entry.title: Persistent current of two-chain Hubbard model with impurities
entry.summary: The interplay between impurities and interactions is studied in the gapless phase of two-chain Hubbard model in order to see how the screening of impurity potentials due to repulsive interactions in single-chain model will be changed by increasing the number of channels. Renormalization group calculations show that charge stiffness, and hence persistent current, of the two-chain model are less enhanced by interactions than single chain case.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 Pages, RevTeX, No figures, Submitted to PRB

entry.title: Bound States in the One-dimensional Hubbard Model
entry.summary: The Bethe Ansatz equations for the one-dimensional Hubbard model are reexamined. A new procedure is introduced to properly include bound states. The corrected equations lead to new elementary excitations away from half-filling.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, Revtex, typos corrected and footnote added

entry.title: Non-abelian Electrons
entry.summary: We analyze critical and massive SO(5) superspin regimes for correlated electrons on a two-chain ladder. We identify fundamental low energy excitations, which carry the quantum numbers of a free electron, and can be probed in (inverse) photo-emission experiments. These excitations do not obey the usual Pauli Principle, but are governed by specific forms of so-called non-abelian exclusion statistics.

entry.title: On T-violation signals originating from magnetic orders through double exchange mechanism
entry.summary: The photon self energy tensor in a crystal with double exchange and ferromagnetic or canting magnetic orders is analyzed at zero temperature with emphasis on the signal of the time-reversal invariance breaking. Three comparable contributions, spin susceptibility, local magnetic field and spin-orbit coupling are estimated and the prospect of their experimental detection is discussed.

entry.title: A new model to describe the physics of VOPO
entry.summary: In the past different models for the magnetic salt vanadyl pyrophosphate (VOPO) were discussed. Neither a spin ladder nor an alternating chain are capable to describe recently measured magnetic excitations. In this paper we propose a 2D model that fits better to experimental observations.

entry.title: The 1D spin-1/2 AF-Heisenberg model in a staggered field
entry.summary: We investigate the scaling properties of the excitation energies and transition amplitudes of the one-dimensional spin-$1\over 2$ antiferromagnetic Heisenberg model exposed to an external perturbation. Two types of perturbations are discussed in detail: a staggered field and a dimerized field.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 6 figures, to be published in Euro. Phys. J. B, LaTeX-class svjour from Springer

entry.title: Restoration of Symmetry by Interactions and Nonreliability of the Perturbative Renormalization Group Approach
entry.summary: We discuss examples of (1+1)-dimensional models where the perturbative renormalization group (RG) indicates a tendency to restore the symmetry in the strong coupling limit. We show that such restoration does occur sometimes, but the pertubative RG cannot be reliably used to detect it.

entry.title: Exact Result on Hole Dynamics of One-Dimensional Supersymmetric t-J Model with Long Range Interaction
entry.summary: We obtain an exact result on single hole dynamics in one-dimensional Mott-insulators through the study on the supersymmetric t-J model with long range interaction at half-filling. We calculate the expression G_{1s1h}(x,t) for one spinon one holon contribution to the hole propagator. We find that G_{1s1h}(x=0,t=0)=3/8, which amounts to 75% of the spin-fixed mean particle density 1/2.

entry.title: Spin excitations in ferromagnetic manganites
entry.summary: An effective one-band Hamiltonian for colossal-magnetoresistance (CMR) manganites is constructed and the spin excitations are determined. Fitting the experimental data by the derived spin-wave dispersion gives an e_g -electron hopping amplitude of about 0.2 eV in agreement with LDA band calculations.

entry.title: Formfactors in the half-filled Hubbard model
entry.summary: We consider dynamical spin-spin correlation functions in the one dimensional repulsive half-filled Hubbard model. We propose an exact expression for the two spinon formfactor of spin operators. We use this to derive the two spinon contribution to the dynamical structure factor.

entry.title: Localization and transport in pseudoternary ruthenates
entry.summary: The temperature dependence of the electrical resistivity of two chemically substituted Ca-ruthenates is examined with the Efros-Shklovskii mechanism invoking Coulomb interactions between carriers. Additional mechanisms causing an energy dependence to the density of states at the Fermi surface may explain the unusually wide temperature and conductivity range obeyed by one system.

entry.title: "Symmetry properties of magnetization in the Hubbard model at finite temperature": Comment on 'Reply to Comment'
entry.summary: We comment on the Reply of G. Su and M. Suzuki [cond-mat/9808011] to our Comment [cond-mat/9807402] about the papers of G. Su [Phys. Rev. B 54, 8291 (1996)] and G. Su and M. Suzuki [Phys. Rev. B 57, 13367 (1998)]. The algebraic mistake originating their incorrect solutions is evidenced in detail.

entry.title: Higher Symmetries in Condensed Matter Physics
entry.summary: We discuss some applications of higher symmetry groups to condensed matter systems. We give special attention to the groups SO(n) (n = 4, 5, 6, 8) in the two-dimensional Hubbard model and its generalizations, which model the high T_c cuprate superconductors.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 2 eps figures. Based on a talk by M. T. Vaughn at PASCOS98, Northeastern University, Boston, March 1988

entry.title: Ferron-like states in YBa_2Cu_3O_(6+x)
entry.summary: With the use of the Hubbard model bound hole states in YBa_2Cu_3O_(6+x) are studied. For the parameters of this crystal the exchange interaction between the spin-carrying chain ion O^- and Cu-O plane sites is shown to ensure the formation of a large ferromagnetically ordered clusters around holes in the plane.

author.name: P. Rubin
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Physics, University of Tartu

author.name: A. Sherman
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Physics, University of Tartu

entry.title: Edge tunneling in fractional quantum Hall regime
entry.summary: We address the issue of an apparent disagreement between theory and experiment on the I-V characteristic of electron tunneling from a metal to the edge of a two-dimensional electron gas in the fractional quantum Hall regime. A part of our result is a theory for the edge of the half-filled Landau level.

entry.title: On the Origin of Quantum Oscillations in the Mixed State of Anisotropic Superconductor
entry.summary: For the vortex lattice in an anisotropic superconductor with well-separated cores (Hc1<<B<<Hc2) it is shown that sizable de Haas-van Alphen oscillations are caused by the levels` crossing of the energy threshold separating localized and extended states of excitations moving in the average magnetic field,B.

entry.title: Ground-State Properties of the Two-Band Model for Halogen-Bridged Metal Complexes
entry.summary: Based on a symmetry argument, we systematically reveal Hartree-Fock broken-symmetry solutions of the one-dimensional two-band extended Peierls-Hubbard model. Performing numerical investigations as well, the possibility of novel density-wave states appearing is argued.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, 6 PS figures, to appear in Synth. Mets. (ICSM'98)

entry.title: Small denominators and anomalous behaviour in the Holstein-Hubbard model
entry.summary: We consider a system of interacting fermions on a chain in a periodic potential incommensurate with the chain spacing. We derive a convergent perturbative expansion, afflicted by a small denominator problem and based on renormalization group, for the two point Schwinger function. We obtain the large distance behavior of the Schwinger function, which is anomalous and described by critical indices, related to the gap and the wave function renormalization.

entry.title: Phase Diagram of the 2-Leg Heisenberg Ladder with Alternating Dimerization
entry.summary: Using the Lanczos method we determine the phase diagram of the 2-leg AF-Heisenberg ladder with alternating dimerization. It consists of a resonating valence bond phase and a dimer phase separated by a critical line. Our results are in good agreement with previous conjectures obtained with the non linear sigma model.
entry.arxiv:comment: REVTEX file, 10 pages, 3 figures. To appear in PLA

entry.title: Classical frustration and quantum disorder in spin-orbital models
entry.summary: The most elementary of all physical spin-orbital models is the Kugel-Khomskii model describing a S=1/2, $e_g$ degenerate Mott-insulator. Recent theoretical work is reviewed revealing that the classical limit is characterized by a point of perfect dynamical frustration. It is suggested that this might give rise to a quantum disordered ground state.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages Revtex, 3 ps figures, proceedings 1998 NEC symposium, Nasu, Japan

entry.title: Effective mass at the surface of a Fermi liquid
entry.summary: Using the dynamical mean-field theory, we calculate the effective electron mass in the Hubbard model on a semi-infinite lattice. At the surface the effective mass is strongly enhanced. Near half-filling this gives rise to a correlation-driven one-electron surface mode.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX, 2 pages, 1 eps figure included, Physica B (in press), SCES 98

entry.title: Boson-Fermion Model of High-T_C Superconductivity ----A Progress Report
entry.summary: This is an invited lecture at the XXII International School of Theoretical Physics, Ustron, Poland, 9/10-9/15, 1998. The boson-fermion model of high T_C superconductivity is reviewed. Its applications to the pseudo-gap and DC transport coefficients are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, 3 figures; A few changes in the quotations

entry.title: Sine-Gordon low-energy effective theory for Copper Benzoate
entry.summary: Specific heat data for the quasi one dimensional quantum magnet Copper Benzoate (Cu(C_6D_5COO)_2 \cdot 3D_2O) is analyzed in the framework of an effective low-energy description in terms of a Sine-Gordon theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: revised version, to appear in PRB

entry.title: Hidden Integrability of a Kondo Impurity in an Unconventional Host
entry.summary: We study a spin-1/2 Kondo impurity coupled to an unconventional host in which the density of band states vanishes either precisely at (``gapless'' systems) or on some interval around the Fermi level (``gapped''systems). Despite an essentially nonlinear band dispersion, the system is proven to exhibit hidden integrability and is diagonalized exactly by the Bethe ansatz.

author.name: Valery I. Rupasov
author.arxiv:affiliation: U. of Toronto and Landau Institute

entry.title: Potential scattering and the Kondo effect
entry.summary: We study a generalized Kondo model in which a spin-1/2 impurity is coupled to a conduction band by both s-d exchange and potential interactions. A strong potential scattering is shown to screen an exchange scattering, and the Kondo temperature of the system is decreased.

author.name: Valery I. Rupasov
author.arxiv:affiliation: U. of Toronto and Landau Institute

entry.title: On localization effects in underdoped cuprates
entry.summary: We comment on transport experiments in underdoped LaSrCuO in the non-superconducting phase. The temperature dependence of the resistance strongly resembles what is expected from standard localization theory. However this theory fails, when comparing with experiments in more detail.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, to be published in J. of Superconductivity

entry.title: Magnetooptical sum rules close to the Mott transition
entry.summary: We derive new sum rules for the real and imaginary parts of the frequency-dependent Hall constant and Hall conductivity. As an example, we discuss their relevance to the doped Mott insulator that we describe within the dynamical mean-field theory of strongly correlated electron systems.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 4 ps figures; accepted for publication in PRL

entry.title: Spin dynamics in the generalized ferromagnetic Kondo model for manganites
entry.summary: Dynamical spin susceptibility is calculated for the generalized ferromagnetic Kondo model which describes itinerant $e_{g}$ electrons interacting with localized $t_{2g}$ electrons with antiferromagnetic coupling. The calculations done in the mean field approximation show that the spin-wave spectrum of the system in ferromagnetic state has two branches, acoustic and optic ones. Self-energy corrections to the spectrum are considered and the acoustic spin-wave damping is evaluated.

entry.title: Exact solution of a spin-ladder model
entry.summary: An integrable spin-ladder model with nearest-neighbor exchanges and biquadratic interactions is proposed. With the Bethe ansatz solutions of the model hamiltonian, it is found that there are three possible phases in the ground state, i.e., a rung-dimerized phase with a spin gap, and two massless phases. The possible fixed points of the system and the quantum critical behavior at the critical point $J=J_+^c$ are discussed.

entry.title: Quantum Lifshitz Point
entry.summary: I study a quantum Lifshitz point in a three-dimensional itinerant antiferromagnet, in particular the scaling of the N\'{e}el temperature, the correlation length, the staggered susceptibility, the specific heat coefficient and the resistivity. At low temperatures, the model is shown to have the inverse staggered susceptibility and the resistivity varying as T$^{5/4}$, and the specific heat coefficient varying as T$^{1/4}$.

entry.title: Anomalous BCS equation for a Luttinger superconductor
entry.summary: In the context of the Anderson theory of high T_c cuprates, we develop a BCS theory for Luttinger liquids. If the Luttinger interaction is much stronger than the BCS potential we find that the BCS equation is quite modified compared to usual BCS equation for Fermi liquids. In particular T_c predicted by the BCS equation for Luttinger liquids is quite higher than the usual T_c for Fermi liquids.

entry.title: Cluster transfer matrix method for the single electron box
entry.summary: With the newly developed cluster transfer matrix method, we calculate the average electron number n vs nx (the polarization charge) for varying junction conductance and its first derivative at nx=0 for finite temperatures, and demonstrate that the new method is as powerful as the Monte Carlo and renormalization group methods.

entry.title: Recurrent Variational Approach to the Two-Leg Hubbard Ladder
entry.summary: We applied the Recurrent Variational Approach to the two-leg Hubbard ladder. At half-filling, our variational Ansatz was a generalization of the resonating valence bond state. At finite doping, hole pairs were allowed to move in the resonating valence bond background. The results obtained by the Recurrent Variational Approach were compared with results from Density Matrix Renormalization Group.

entry.title: Renormalization group approach of itinerant electron systems near the Lifshitz point
entry.summary: Using the renormalization approach proposed by Millis for the itinerant electron systems we calculated the specific heat coefficient $\gamma(T)$ for the magnetic fluctuations with susceptibility $\chi^{-1}\sim |\delta+\omega|^\alpha+f(q)$ near the Lifshitz point. The constant value obtained for $\alpha=4/5$ and the logarithmic temperature dependence, specific for the non-Fermi behavior, have been obtained in agreement with the experimental dat.

entry.title: Local Electronic Structure and High Temperature Superconductivity
entry.summary: It is argued that a new mechanism and many-body theory of superconductivity are required for doped correlated insulators. Here we review the essential features of and the experimental support for such a theory, in which the physics is driven by the kinetic energy.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 Pages Latex. For the Proceedings of HTS99, Miami, FL, Jan. 1999

entry.title: Electronic Transport in La-Ca Manganites
entry.summary: We revisit the transport properties of La-Ca manganites in detail, since they have been confirmed in a number of CMR-exhibiting materials. We also discuss new data considered the hallmark of an unusually high electron-phonon coupling responsible for charge localization and small polaron transport.
entry.arxiv:comment: 23 pages, 7 comb. figures, 98 references. To be published in the proceedings of the Workshop on Physics of Manganites, MSU, July 1998

entry.title: Effect of coulomb long range interactions on the Mott transition
entry.summary: We reconsider the Mott transition problem in the presence of long range Coulomb interactions. Using an extended DMFT, that sums an important class of diagrams absent in ordinary DMFT, we show that in the presence of Coulomb the Mott transition in two and three dimensions is discontinuous as envisioned by Mott.

entry.title: Induced Luttinger Liquid Behavior in an Exactly Solvable Model of Stripes
entry.summary: We study an exactly solvable model describing a stripe consisting of a Toda array of $N$ anharmonic elastic chains sandwiched between two conducting chains. It is shown that the presence of a charge on one chain generates a gapless excitation branch (Luttinger liquid) on the other and leads to increase in the phonon frequencies.

entry.title: Absence of the Mott transition in infinite dimensions
entry.summary: It is shown that the half filled Hubbard model does not display the Mott metal-insulator transition, in the limit of infinite dimensions. The proposed transition on the Bethe lattice is proved to be an artifact. In the atomic limit, the model is always in the antiferromagnetic phase, which can be described by the Weiss mean field model.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, inaccurate formulation after Eq.(2) corrected

entry.title: Non-Fermi behavior of the disorder electronic system
entry.summary: We showed that an electronic system with weak disorder considered in the finite-charge infinite U Hubbard model can present a non-Fermi behavior. The imaginary pert of the self-energy has been calculated and a linear temperature dependence was obtained. This result is in agreement with the non-Fermi behavior observed at the insulator-metal crossover in La_{2-x}Sr_xCuO_4.

entry.title: The dimer-RVB State of the Four-Leg Heisenberg Ladder: Interference among Resonances
entry.summary: We study the ground state of the 4-leg spin ladder using a dimer-RVB ansatz and the Lanczos method. Besides the well known resonance mechanism between valence bond configurations we find novel interference effects among nearby resonances.

entry.title: On the thermodynamics of strongly correlated integrable electron systems
entry.summary: We reexamine the Yang-Yang-Takahashi method of deriving the thermodynamic Bethe ansatz equations which describe strongly correlated electron systems of fundamental physical interest, such as the Hubbard, $s-d$ exchange (Kondo) and Anderson models. It is shown that these equations contain some additional terms which may play an important role in the physics of the systems.

author.name: Valery I. Rupasov
author.arxiv:affiliation: U. of Toronto and Landau Institute

entry.title: Orbital Dynamics: The Origin of Anomalous Magnon Softening in Ferromagnetic Manganites
entry.summary: We study the renormalization of magnons by charge and coupled orbital-lattice fluctuations in colossal magnetoresistance compounds. The model considered is an orbitally degenerate double-exchange system coupled to Jahn-Teller active phonons. The modulation of ferromagnetic bonds by low-energy orbital fluctuations is identified as the main origin of the unusual softening of the zone-boundary magnons observed experimentally in manganites.

entry.title: Modulated Phases in Spin-Peierls Systems
entry.summary: Lattice modulations in the high magnetic field phase and close to impurities in spin-Peierls systems are considered and compared to experiment. Necessary extensions of existing theories are proposed. The influence of zero-point fluctuations on magnetic amplitudes is shown.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 4 figures included, to appear in Advances in Solid State Physics/Festkoerperprobleme Spring Conference 1999 of the DPG
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: in Advances in Solid State Physics 39, 291 (1999), Ed. B. Kramer (Vieweg, Braunschweig)

entry.title: Topological spin excitations of Heisenberg antiferromagnets in two dimensions
entry.summary: In this paper we discuss the construction and the dynamics of vortex-like topological spin excitations in the Schwinger-boson description of Heisenberg antiferromagnets in two dimensions. The topological spin excitations are Dirac fermions (with gap) when spin value $S$ is a half-integer. Experimental and theoretical implications of these excitations are being investigated.

entry.title: 1D Luttinger liquid & QED
entry.summary: Using its Conformal Field Theory description, the Luttinger liquid is coupled to the quantum electromagnetic field. We compute the decoherence properties of a superposition of two states obtained by creating the same elementary excitation at different places in the system.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 1 figure, Invited talk at XXXIVth Rencontres de Moriond 1999 (Quantum Physics at Mesoscopic Scale) Jan 23-30, 1999. To appear in the proceedings of the conference

entry.title: Broken-Symmetry Ground States of Halogen-Bridged Binuclear Metal Complexes
entry.summary: Based on a symmetry argument, we study ground states of what we call MMX-chain compounds, which are the new class of halogen-bridged metal complexes. Commensurate density-wave solutions of a relevant multi-band Peierls-Hubbard model are systematically revealed within the Hartree-Fock approximation. We numerically draw ground-state phase diagrams, where various novel density-wave states appear.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 4 figures embedded, to appear in Phys. Lett. A

entry.title: Reply to the Comment by Kiselev and Bouis
entry.summary: The possibility of the ferromagnetic state modifies the phase diagram in Phys.Rev.Lett.81,3723(1998), as Kiselev and Bouis have pointed out. However, the unconventional SDW that has been proposed in the letter above is still a candidate for the curious magnetism in URu_2Si_2.
entry.arxiv:comment: REVTeX v3.1, 1 page, 2 figures, to appear in Phys. Rev. Lett., This is the reply to the comment by Kiselev and Bouis on Phys. Rev. Lett. 81, 3723 (1998) (cond-mat/9905316)

entry.title: Do correlations create an energy gap in electronic bilayers? Critical analysis of different approaches
entry.summary: This paper investigates the effect of correlations in electronic bilayers on the longitudinal collective mode structure. We employ the dielectric permeability constructed by means of the classical theory of moments. It is shown that the neglection of damping processes overestimates the role of correlations. We conclude that the correct account of damping processes leads to an absence of an energy gap.

entry.title: Orthogonality Catastrophes in Carbon Nanotubes
entry.summary: Carbon nanotubes provide a remarkably versatile system in which to explore the effects of Coulomb interactions in one dimension. The most dramatic effects of strong electron-electron repulsion are *orthogonality catastrophes*. These orthogonality catastrophes come in different varieties, and can be observed both in low-bias transport and tunneling measurements on nanotubes. This article contains a review of previous work and new material on the crossover between Coulomb blockade and Luttinger behavior.
entry.arxiv:comment: 1999 Moriond Les Arcs Conference Proceedings: 7 pages, 1 figure

entry.title: Exact results for the one dimensional periodic Anderson model at finite U
entry.summary: We present exact results for the periodic Anderson model for finite Hubbard interaction 0 <= U < +infinity on certain restricted domains of the model's phase diagram, in d=1 dimension. Decomposing the Hamiltonian into positive semidefinite terms we find two quantum states to be ground state, an insulating and a metallic one. The ground state energy and several ground state expectation values are calculated.

entry.title: Luttinger liquid behavior in single wall nanotubes
entry.summary: Transport properties of metallic single-wall nanotubes are examined based on the Luttinger liquid theory. Focusing on a nanotube transistor setup, the linear conductance is computed from the Kubo formula using perturbation theory in the lead-tube tunnel conductances. For sufficiently long nanotubes and high temperature, phonon backscattering should lead to an anomalous temperature dependence of the resistivity.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, to appear in IWEPNM99 proceedings 1999, incl 2 figures

entry.title: Theory of Doped Excitonic Insulators
entry.summary: The theory of doped excitonic insulators is reinvestigated in light of recent experiments on hexaborides. For the appropriate valley-degenerate X_3,X_3' band structure, ``intra-valley'' condensation is energetically favored. Ferromagnetism occurs upon doping due to the quenching of kinetic energy at the otherwise direct first-order excitonic insulator-metal transition.
